notesStmt.note: Folio 120v: Psalterium istud est Monasterii Sancti Benedicti. Monastery of Sancta Maria de angelis in Florence and of Sanct Benedict outside the walls in Florence, inscribed as owners of this psaltery in several Latin notes on folios 1v, 3r, 120v. Folio 121v, records of birth, with a date of 5422 (1662).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 6 leaves each. Catchwords trimmed away.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Fine Sefardi square script, punctuated, of the 14th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Löwy, Albert (Abraham) (b. 1816, d. 1908), Hebrew scholar and minister in the West London Synagogue of British Jews: purchased by the British Library from him on 10 January 1852: inscribed on folio [123v].
